group_1.textLeft: *Chuckle*
This is an incredibly mysterious situation.

group_1.textRight: ｜More mysterious than a Rumor?｜

group_1.textLeft: I'd say it's just as mysterious, if not moreso,@than the Rumors.

group_1.textRight: ｜Is that a good thing?｜

group_1.textLeft: I suppose that comes down to how the cogs of@destiny fall in place.
What about Futatsugi?

group_1.textRight: That's a good question.
We had wondered about what the lives of@Promised Blood had been like.
Based on what Kagome informed me of their@backgrounds,
I've been examining statistics related to crime@and accidents in Futatsugi City.

group_1.textLeft: What did you find?

group_1.textRight: After a certain point, the number of crimes and@accidents began to dwindle.
Once we started gathering Witches, however,@those numbers crashed even further.

group_1.textLeft: *Giggles*
Incredible. The happiness of human society@maps directly to the suffering of Magical Girls.
This little trick to keeping the universe alive is@horribly cruel once you look at the raw numbers.

group_1.textRight: For those ignorant of the existence of Magical@Girls, however, it must be the ultimate bliss.

group_1.textLeft: So what, is that all you found out? It's totally in@line with our expectations.

group_1.textRight: No, there's more. With the Witches gone,@the number of Grief Seeds declines as well.
Naturally, that's leading to a rise in the accidental@deaths and disappearances of adolescent girls.
When put against the decrease in total crime and@such incidents, the contrast should be glaring.
I can't help but wonder why this isn't even@a topic of discussion.

group_1.textLeft: It's like there's a national conspiracy to cover@it up!
Oh, wait…if that were the case, they wouldn't@have published these numbers to begin with...

group_1.textRight: Correct.

group_1.textLeft: Still, at least we're aware of this mystery.
Keying in Kagome turned out to be the right call.
This is exciting! We're getting even closer to@unlocking the mysteries of the universe!

group_1.textRight: You look exactly as you did as a Magius, Touka.
Getting back to the topic, what results did you get?@I believe you were looking into the Tokime Clan.

group_1.textLeft: Well, the thing is, I can't find any references to@them in the first place...
I thought my uncle's failed book would be@a useful source,
but I can't find a copy of it anywhere...

group_1.textRight: No success, then? How strangely suspicious.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, I know.
I don't know how the Tokime Clan did it, but it's@impressive they've been able to keep a settlement
so deeply intertwined with the government@hidden for all this time.
I think it's showing us some interesting@possibilities.

group_1.textRight: Possibilities?

group_1.textLeft: That's right!
You know how they refer to Magical Girls as@Diviners?
That stands out as a distinct term for@extraordinary girls.
I think it points to how Magical Girls are hidden@in plain sight.
It's notable that no other such terms have@survived to the present day.
All in all, it's a rare example.

group_1.textRight: Even if such terms exist in reference to an@individual,
they're merely used as alternate titles that don't@survive the test of time.

group_1.textLeft: It could indicate that people have seen Magical@Girls throughout history,
but they were only perceived as heroic figures,@and nothing more.
That's the case with Jeanne d'Arc, whom my@uncle traveled abroad to investigate.
Even Himiko, the legendary shaman queen,@might be a Japanese example.

group_1.textRight: Hm… So for a time, Magical Girls were@recognized in society not as common folk,
but as a special entity.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, exactly!

group_1.textRight: ｜It somewhat resembles the stories you two@brought about in Kamihama.｜

group_1.textLeft: Hmm… Maybe so.
What makes you say that?

group_1.textRight: ｜When Nemu was using us Uwasa to extract@energy,｜
｜despite there being substance to the [textBlue:Rumors],@they remained mere urban legends nonetheless.｜

group_1.textLeft: ...I wasn't aware of that, but it's an unusual@circumstance worth taking into account.

group_1.textRight: ｜I have also heard a legend passed down in@Kamihama regarding girls known as Shamanesses.｜

group_1.textLeft: Like the one Ui was talking about?

group_1.textRight: Are you referring to the tale from the movie that@Yachiyo and Tsuruno appeared in?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, I think it was a special drama done for@Tanabata. It's an old legend in Kamihama.

group_1.textRight: ...[wait:0.8][chara:101471:voiceFull_fullvoice/section_102803/vo_full_102803-2-66][chara:101471:lipSynch_1]Let's look into it.
We may be able to find these women by visiting@the historiography room in the Chuo Ward library.
And while we're at it, I'd like to pull up some@comparisons between Kamihama and Futatsugi.
｜That is forbidden.｜

group_1.textLeft: What?

group_1.textRight: ｜Iroha and Ui warned it was dangerous to go@outside today.｜

group_1.textLeft: ...No, Sakurako, it's fine.

group_1.textRight: ｜Oh? Was I mistaken?｜

group_1.textLeft: While both Ui and Big Sis say it's dangerous@to go outside,
it just means that they're counting on you@to take care of us.
That means we have free reign as long as@you protect us!
Nemu and I are depending on you big time!

group_1.textRight: ｜...[wait:0.8][chara:304301:cheek_0][chara:304301:face_mtn_ex_000.exp3.json][chara:304301:voiceFull_fullvoice/section_102803/vo_full_102803-2-78][chara:304301:lipSynch_1]I see.｜
｜Very well. I'll ensure you're kept safe.｜
To take advantage of Sakurako's innocence like@that... You are simply cruel and unjust, Touka.

group_1.textLeft: Well, it's not like I had a choice! I need to see@Papa at the hospital today.

group_1.textRight: ...Ah, it's Kanagi.

group_1.textLeft: Ugh, talk about bad timing...
